intro: Rhysolepis peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are often followed by distinctive, triangular seed pods. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
